to.description: Recipient's phone number. Must be in E.164 format

from.description: If you lease a phone number from Contiguity, you can use a specific one by providing it here.

message_id.description: The message's ID. Use it to refer to this message in the future, when checking the status of the message or finding it in the Console.

to.description: Recipient email address(es). Can be a string or array of up to 10 addresses

cc.description: Carbon copy email address(es). Can be a string or array of up to 10 addresses

bcc.description: Blind carbon copy email address(es). Can be a string or array of up to 10 addresses

email_id.description: The email's ID. Use it to refer to this email in the future, when checking the status of the email or finding it in the Console.

to.description: Recipient's WhatsApp number. Must be in E.164 format.

from.description: Your leased WhatsApp number. If none is provided, we will use a random WhatsApp number of yours.

when.description: When to fallback to SMS/RCS. If the recipient does not have WhatsApp, or if WhatsApp fails to send.

from.description: Your leased SMS/RCS number. If none is provided, we will use a random SMS/RCS number of yours. In some instances, your WhatsApp number may support SMS/RCS, and we will fallback to that if left blank.

fallback.description: Should Contiguity fallback to SMS/RCS if the recipient does not have WhatsApp, or if WhatsApp fails to send?

attachments.description: Attachments to send. Can be a URL to your attachment (e.g. example.com/image.png) or a base64 string. Max 10 attachments, with a cumulative size of 50MB.

message_id.description: The message's ID. Use it to refer to this message in the future, when checking the status of the message or finding it in the Console.

to.description: Recipient's WhatsApp number. Must be in E.164 format.

from.description: Your leased WhatsApp number. If none is provided, we will use a random WhatsApp number of yours.

action.description: Whether to start or stop sending typing indicators

200.description: Start or stop sending typing indicators over WhatsApp

to.description: Recipient's WhatsApp number. Must be in E.164 format.

action.description: Whether to add or remove a reaction

reaction.description: The emoji reaction to send (e.g., '👍', '❤️', or :thumbs_up:, :heart:, :haha: etc.)

message.description: Provide either a WhatsApp ID, or complete content of the message to react to.

200.description: Add or remove a reaction to a WhatsApp message

message.description: Text description of the completed action.

to.description: Recipient's iMessage address. Must be in E.164 format (unless it is an email, however this method is not recommended).

from.description: Your leased iMessage number. If none is provided, we will use a random iMessage number of yours.

when.description: When to fallback to SMS/RCS. If the recipient does not have iMessage, or if iMessage fails to send.

from.description: Your leased SMS/RCS number. If none is provided, we will use a random SMS/RCS number of yours. In some instances, your iMessage number may support SMS/RCS, and we will fallback to that if left blank.

fallback.description: Should Contiguity fallback to SMS/RCS if the recipient does not have iMessage, or if iMessage fails to send?

attachments.description: Attachments to send. Can be a URL to your attachment (e.g. example.com/image.png) or a base64 string. Max 10 attachments, with a cumulative size of 50MB.

message_id.description: The message's ID. Use it to refer to this message in the future, when checking the status of the message or finding it in the Console.

to.description: Recipient's iMessage address. Must be in E.164 format.

from.description: Your leased iMessage number. If none is provided, we will use a random iMessage number of yours.

action.description: Whether to start or stop sending typing indicators

200.description: Start or stop sending typing indicators over iMessage

to.description: Recipient's iMessage address. Must be in E.164 format.

from.description: The iMessage number that you have been using to send messages to this recipient.

200.description: Send read receipt to an iMessage recipient

to.description: Recipient's iMessage address. Must be in E.164 format.

from.description: Your leased iMessage number that has been used to send messages to the recipient. Must be in E.164 format.

action.description: Whether to add or remove a reaction

message.description: The full content of the message to react to – Contiguity will find the latest message that matches.

200.description: Add or remove a reaction to an iMessage
